channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ozempic May Help Treat Kidney Disease, Study Finds
item.description: A major clinical trial showed such promising results that the drug’s maker halted it early.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Top U.N. Court Expected to Rule on Israel’s Assault on Rafah
item.description: South Africa has requested that the International Court of Justice in The Hague order Israel to halt its ground assault in southern Gaza.

item.title: Elon Musk predicts jobs will become ‘kinda like a hobby’
item.description: "In a benign scenario probably none of us will have a job."

item.title: A Polling Risk for Trump
item.description: His advantage may not be as stable as it looks.

item.title: Israel Recovers Bodies of 3 More Hostages in Gaza
item.description: The bodies were found in Jabaliya, where the Israeli military has been trying to root out a renewed Hamas insurgency.

item.title: ‘A glaring blind spot’ in housing affordability: Mortgage underwriting and home appraisals should account for energy costs. Here’s why
item.description: Ensuring home affordability is crucial to protecting the American Dream, but the monthly mortgage payment is just one part of the cost of owning a home.

item.title: How Could Alito Have Been So Foolish to Fly an Upside-Down American Flag?
item.description: Displaying an upside-down American flag shouldn’t have happened.

item.title: Ukraine Starts Freeing Some Prisoners to Join Its Military
item.description: At least 50 convicts have been freed under a new law that allows them to serve in exchange for the possibility of parole, part of an effort to replenish Ukraine’s depleted forces.

item.title: Fake AI-generated Biden robocalls orchestrator faces $6m fine and criminal charges
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission said the fine it proposed for Steven Kramer is its first involving generative AI technology.

item.title: Minnesota Republicans Just Endorsed an Alex Jones Acolyte for Senate
item.description: Alex Jones, Steve Bannon and the left-to-right pipeline.

item.title: Sports Betting Company Drops Boris Johnson From Soccer Ad
item.description: The script called for the former prime minister, and Brexit champion, to don an England jersey and say, ‘I told you I would get us back in Europe.’

item.title: Tiny Scottish island, with more sheep than people, becomes the U.K.'s first spaceport for vertical rockets
item.description: Former military site, SaxaVord, is one of seven spaceports being built around the U.K. in the wake of new laws encouraging private investment in the space industry.

item.title: A Week of Diplomatic Blows to Israel, and Congress Criticizes Alito
item.description: Plus, a big step toward college athlete pay.

item.title: Barcelona’s Success Transforms the City Into the Women’s Soccer Capital
item.description: The success of Barcelona’s team has made Catalonia a laboratory for finding out what happens when the women’s game has prominence similar to the men’s.

item.title: Louisiana legislature approves bill that would punish the possession of abortion pills without a prescription with hefty fines and jail time
item.description: Two abortion-inducing drugs could soon be reclassified as controlled and dangerous substances in Louisiana under a first-of-its-kind bill that received final legislative passage Thursday.
